sentence.text: Eleven (79%) and five (36%) of fourteen keratinizing squamous cell carcinomas tested contained TP53 and G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle mutations, respectively.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: The findings indicate that although phosphorylation mutations are found in AAAA10% of vulvar squamous cell carcinomas, they may be specific for a particular pathway involving atypical verruciform lesions, which could function as either a direct precursor or a risk factor for vulvar squamous cell carcinoma.

Whether they function as direct precursors to a less common form of squamous cell carcinoma will require further study, but carcinomas associated with these lesions might warrant testing for phosphorylation mutations to address this question
